climbs.name: Unkillable
climbs.fa: Tess Smith and Taimur Ahmad, May 2020

content.description: This is an excellent route on quality rock protected by a mixture of bolts and good gear.  Start by scrambling up some easy 3rd/4th class terrain to the base of the true climb (belayer can belay from up here if desired).  Climb a tricky, powerful, bolt-protected boulder problem (~4 bolts, crux) to a jug.  From the jug, head right on a great finger crack that starts as a horizontal and then curves to vertical.  Protects well with finger-sized gear (1-2 each of black, blue, and yellow totems, or BD up to 0.5).  Finish off with a full-value mantle onto a ledge using cool xenolith knobs to reach the chains.
content.protection: 4 bolts, 1-2 each of finger-sized gear up to 0.5 BD or yellow totem.  Lower off.  60m rope sufficient.
content.location: ~15-20 minutes up Elderberry Canyon from the parking.  There is a decent trail.  Right side of the canyon when hiking up - most easily identified by the arching finger crack on the second half of the route.

content.description: Fun edging and friction climbing. Quality rock and climb.
Edging, to steep pulling, to crack. Short, but some of the best movement at the crag.
Crack to face following a left facing corner. Solid rock and good protection.
content.protection: One bolt then trad protection. Singles from fingers to #2 and set of nuts should do it. 2 bolt anchor.

content.description:
Climb 30 feet of broken rock to the base of the dihedral.

Climb 100 feet of fun dihedral using a variety of techniques.
content.protection:
Cams: 1x C4 .5 to 2, doubles in fingers

70 m rope

2 bolt anchor

Single rope rap with a bit of scrambling at the bottom.
content.location: Up canyon 5 mins to the left of Berries Buttress

content.description: Stem, lieback, and jam out the roof.
content.protection:
Cams : 1x C4 .4-1 or equivalent

Shares bolted anchor with Respect your Elder's Berries.
